Microssa

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Microssa.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is responsible for writing MatchingEngine events to a database.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean Connected
      Whether we are able to write to the database connection.

      How often to scan the database for new orders, in milliseconds

      Reference to MatchingEngine object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database(java.lang.String name,
                MatchingEngine me)
        The constructor stores information for when the Thread is started, but does not start it on its own.
        Parameters:
        name - A string identifier for the future Thread
        me - A reference to the MatchingEngine this socket is supposed to connect

    • Method Detail

      • WriteMatch

        public void WriteMatch(Order a,
                       Order p,
                       double px,
                       double qty)

      • run

        public void run()
        Notifies the MatchingEngine that this interface exists. Scans the inbound_order table for order actions and forwards these actions to the Matching Engine. Deleted completed order actions. This function never exits, which requires killing Microssa to stop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.sql.SQLException
        Starts the Thread. Attempts to connect to the database. Sends a message to Logger to indicate successful start.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Failure to connect to database
        java.io.IOException - Passthrough from Logger
